column3: Improved the code to use an ifdef for OSX instead.
@laanwj When I find some time I will add to platformstyle.cpp and update the translation files as it isn't difficult, just time consuming.
@paveljanik thats what happens when you edit via mobile and online on GitHub
@laanwj @jonasschnelli @paveljanik \n\nAll squashed and good to go ;)
In the help of e.g. Terminal and Safari, I see Command (‚åò)-L notation.\n
I realised that this work was not done on a Bitcoin fork and in fact a fork of Dash, that had been subsequently deleted, the new PR for this is #10362
I'm not usually a person to say this but: let's make this message platform dependent instead of enumerating the platforms here.
@laanwj #ifdef Q_OS_MAC it?

Possible suggestion: ```c++ #ifdef Q_OS_MAC QString clearKeyStr = "‚åòcmd-L"; #else QString clearKeyStr = "Ctrl-L"; #endif ... tr("Use up and down arrows to navigate history, and %1 to clear screen.").arg(clearKeyStr) + "
" + ``` After all: - The key is not to be translated - Also gets rid of the HTML formatting in the translation string in one go

If we are already bikeshedding:\nAlternative suggestion would be adding `QString generalFunctionKey()` to platformstyles.cpp.\nThen use something like `tr("Use up and down arrows to navigate history, and %1-L to clear screen.").arg(platformStyle->generalFunctionKey())`
I guess you can also do `arg(""+platformStyle->generalFunctionKey()+"")` to avoid html in translatable strings.

Yes, adding it to platformStyle would be another step further, I didn't want to suggest that here to not make life too difficult for @spencerlievens while also not making life harder for translators by adding another message that is almost-the-same.\n
Yeah adding to platform style is certainly the more "correct" path, but induces a lot of work.
There is a TAB on this otherwise empty line.
Can you please move this HTML down to `arg(clsKey)`? E.g. ```C++ arg(""+clsKey+) ``` or something and remove it from here?
Spaces replaced by TABs? Why?\n
Urgh that was my editor.
Done\n
Done
